meanings.definition: A small decorative stroke on a letter or symbol in typography.
meanings.sent1: The ceriph on the 't' made the letter look fancy.
meanings.sent2: The ceriph on the 'g' added a nice touch to the font.
meanings.sent3: The ceriph on the 'q' looked like a tiny crown.
meanings.sent4: Her handwriting had ceriphs that danced across the page.
meanings.sent5: The ceriph on the 'y' was like a delicate swirl of icing on a cake.

meanings.definition: A decorative flourish added to the end of a stroke in calligraphy.
meanings.sent1: The calligrapher carefully added a ceriph to the end of the letter.
meanings.sent2: The ceriph at the end of the stroke gave the writing an elegant finish.
meanings.sent3: The ceriph on the 'z' looked like a playful tail.
meanings.sent4: Her calligraphy was so beautiful, each ceriph seemed to have a life of its own.
meanings.sent5: The ceriph on the 'p' was like a graceful twist at the end of a ribbon.
